message.content: Yes, the authors report error bars in their comprehensive comparison (Table 1). They provide the ± standard deviation values for some of the experiments, indicating that they have considered the variations in performance due to different random seeds or runs.

Yes, the authors report error bars in their experiments. In Table 1 of the paper, the authors provide ± values alongside the reported accuracies, which indicates error bars considering multiple runs with different random seeds.

Yes, the authors report error bars in the comprehensive comparison table (Table 1), where the accuracies are provided with ± notation to indicate the range of variation. This shows that they have taken the random seed variation into account and have run the experiments multiple times to provide a more reliable performance assessment.
